etymology.description: 云(云) (yún, "say") + phonetic: 二(二) (èr) = cloud association; originally depicted the form of clouds
etymology.interpretation: The character 云(云) (yún, "cloud") combines 云(云) (yún, 'say') as a semantic element, originally meaning 'to say' or 'to speak,' but is used phonetically to represent a similar-sounding word for 'cloud.' The character was simplified from 雲(雲) to 云(云), retaining its phonetic and semantic components.
etymology.simplification: The traditional 雲(雲) was simplified by removing the radical 厶(厶) (sī, "private") and merging 冖(冖) (mì, "cover") with 二(二) (èr, "two") for a simpler form 云(云).

examples.chinese: 天空中飘着洁白的云(天空中飄著潔白的雲)。
examples.pinyin: Tiānkōng zhōng piāo zhe jiébái de yún.
examples.english: Beautiful white clouds are floating in the sky.

examples.chinese: 乌云密布时(烏雲密佈時)，可能马上下雨(可能馬上下雨)。
examples.pinyin: Wūyún mìbù shí, kěnéng mǎshàng xiàyǔ.
examples.english: When dark clouds gather, it might rain soon.
